TinyAjax

Simple Ajax class for making XMLHTTP requests within Firefox extensions.  Based off Prototype’s AJAX class.

Usage

ajax = new TinyAjax()
ajax.onStatus_200     = function(){} // Called on a successful result.
ajax.onStatus_404     = function(){} // Called on a 'not found' result.
ajax.onStatus_default = function(){} // Registers a default catch all method.

Additionally you can be notified of changes to the readyState by registering callbacks this way:

ajax = new TinyAjax()
ajax.onReadyState_1  = function(){}
Summary
TinyAjax
Simple Ajax class for making XMLHTTP requests within Firefox extensions.
Functions
TinyAjax
Initializes the Object
request
Initiates the XMLHTTP request to the server.
onStateChange
Called each time the readystate changes.
getResponseHeaders
This method is helpful for debugging the headers returned from a XMLHTTP call.
format_response
Take the response object and reformat it.

Functions

TinyAjax

TinyAjax = function(options)

Initializes the Object

request

TinyAjax.prototype.request = function()

Initiates the XMLHTTP request to the server.

onStateChange

TinyAjax.prototype.onStateChange = function()

Called each time the readystate changes.

getResponseHeaders

TinyAjax.prototype.getResponseHeaders = function()

This method is helpful for debugging the headers returned from a XMLHTTP call.

format_response

TinyAjax.prototype.format_response = function()

Take the response object and reformat it.  Presently, this will only reformat the as a JSON object.
